title: Error Code -32603 when deploying an OpenZeppelin Contract

labels.name: non mainnet (private networks)
labels.description: not related to mainnet features - covers privacy, permissioning, IBFT2, QBFT

body:
### Description
I'm running besu bc locally to run my integration tests. It's a java project, I'm using web3j 4.9.4, and Besu as Nodetype.
I'm able to deploy and interact with the contract I've created, but if I try to deploy the OpenZeppelin's [MinimalForwarder](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/metatx/MinimalForwarder.sol) contract, that i need to implement meta-transactions, Besu returns me an error.

### Acceptance Criteria
* I should be able to deploy the contract.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. wrap MinimalForwarder.sol to a java class with web3j
2. Try to deploy it
`CompletableFuture<MinimalForwarder> forwarder = MinimalForwarder.deploy(web3j, transactionManager, gasProvider).sendAsync();
        while (!forwarder.isDone()) {
            TimeUnit.SECONDS.sleep(5);
            System.out.println("CompletableFuture is not finished yet...");
        }`

**Expected behavior:** 
I expect the contract is deployed

**Actual behavior:**
I receive the following error
`18:19:39.356 [pool-1-thread-1] DEBUG org.web3j.protocol.http.HttpService - {
  "jsonrpc" : "2.0",
  "id" : 5,
  "error" : {
    "code" : -32603,
    "message" : "Internal error"
  }
}`
Full logs at the bottom
**Frequency:** 
100%

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: Docker image: hyperledger/besu:develop-openjdk-17-debug. Tried also with others
* Java version: 17
* OS Name & Version: Mac Os
* Docker Version: latests

### Smart contract information (If you're reporting an issue arising from deploying or calling a smart contract, please supply related information)
* Solidity version: ^0.8.0
* Repo with minimal set of deployable/reproducible contract code - please provide a link
* Please include specifics on how you are deploying/calling the contract 
* Have you reproduced the issue on other eth clients: no, it works with open_ethereum

### Additional Information (Add any of the following or anything else that may be relevant)

Full logs

You might be missing milestone blocks- can you check out this page? https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/latest/public-networks/reference/genesis-items/?h=

@conor10, might be worth updating the genesis files provided by Web3J to avoid genesis milestone block issues?
Hi @non-fungible-nelson, does Besu have an official docker image that could be launched together with the test in a @TestContainer? It would be really nice to speed up the development

@saulgiordani Plz checkout https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/latest/private-networks/get-started/install/run-docker-image/
for faster testing and development or even you can checkout - https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/latest/private-networks/tutorials/quickstart/

Hey @saulgiordani @non-fungible-nelson ,

As mentioned by @non-fungible-nelson  error was due to genesis file, latest milestone blocks were not included. Kindly checkout updated genesis files for web3j-unit and quorum-dev-quickstart. You can use these genesis files to make it work.

For web3j-unit : https://github.com/web3j/web3j-unit/pull/59
For quorum-dev-quickstart: https://github.com/ConsenSys/quorum-dev-quickstart/pull/250

We can close this issue
